integration.production_readinessÂ¶

Source: src\integration\production_readiness.py

Module OverviewÂ¶

Production readiness scoring system with integrated pytest results and system health monitoring.

This module provides comprehensive production readiness assessment by integrating pytest results, coverage monitoring, compatibility analysis, and system health metrics into a unified scoring framework aligned with CLAUDE.md quality standards.

Complete Source CodeÂ¶

  1#==========================================================================================\\\
  2#====================== src/integration/production_readiness.py ==========================\\\
  3#==========================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""Production readiness scoring system with integrated pytest results and system health monitoring.
  6
  7This module provides comprehensive production readiness assessment by integrating
  8pytest results, coverage monitoring, compatibility analysis, and system health metrics
  9into a unified scoring framework aligned with CLAUDE.md quality standards.
 10"""
 11
 12import sys
 13import json
 14import time
 15import sqlite3
 16from pathlib import Path
 17from typing import Dict, List, Any, Optional, Tuple
 18from dataclasses import dataclass, field, asdict
 19from datetime import datetime, timedelta
 20from enum import Enum
 21import logging
 22
 23# Add project paths
 24PROJECT_ROOT = Path(__file__).parent.parent.parent
 25sys.path.insert(0, str(PROJECT_ROOT))
 26sys.path.insert(0, str(PROJECT_ROOT / "src"))
 27
 28try:
 29    from src.utils.coverage.monitoring import CoverageMonitor, CoverageMetrics
 30    from src.integration.compatibility_matrix import CompatibilityMatrix, CompatibilityLevel
 31    from scripts.pytest_automation import PytestIntegrationCoordinator, TestExecutionResult
 32except ImportError as e:
 33    logging.warning(f"Optional import failed: {e}")
 34    CoverageMonitor = None
 35    CompatibilityMatrix = None
 36    PytestIntegrationCoordinator = None
 37
 38logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
 39
 40class ReadinessLevel(Enum):
 41    """Production readiness levels with deployment recommendations."""
 42    PRODUCTION_READY = "production_ready"
 43    CONDITIONAL_READY = "conditional_ready"
 44    NEEDS_IMPROVEMENT = "needs_improvement"
 45    NOT_READY = "not_ready"
 46    BLOCKED = "blocked"
 47
 48class ComponentType(Enum):
 49    """System component types for targeted assessment."""
 50    CONTROLLERS = "controllers"
 51    OPTIMIZATION = "optimization"
 52    TESTING = "testing"
 53    INTEGRATION = "integration"
 54    SAFETY_CRITICAL = "safety_critical"
 55    PERFORMANCE = "performance"
 56    DOCUMENTATION = "documentation"
 57
 58@dataclass
 59class QualityGate:
 60    """Represents a production quality gate with threshold and current value."""
 61    name: str
 62    category: ComponentType
 63    threshold: float
 64    current_value: float
 65    weight: float
 66    passed: bool
 67    critical: bool = False
 68    description: str = ""
 69    recommendations: List[str] = field(default_factory=list)
 70
 71@dataclass
 72class ReadinessAssessment:
 73    """Comprehensive production readiness assessment results."""
 74    timestamp: str
 75    overall_score: float
 76    readiness_level: ReadinessLevel
 77    quality_gates: List[QualityGate]
 78
 79    # Component scores
 80    testing_score: float
 81    coverage_score: float
 82    compatibility_score: float
 83    performance_score: float
 84    safety_score: float
 85    documentation_score: float
 86
 87    # Integration metrics
 88    pytest_results: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None
 89    coverage_metrics: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None
 90    compatibility_analysis: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None
 91
 92    # Deployment readiness
 93    deployment_approved: bool = False
 94    blocking_issues: List[str] = field(default_factory=list)
 95    recommendations: List[str] = field(default_factory=list)
 96    confidence_level: str = "unknown"
 97
 98    # Trend analysis
 99    improvement_trend: str = "stable"
100    historical_comparison: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
101
102class ProductionReadinessScorer:
103    """Comprehensive production readiness scoring system with pytest integration.
104
105    This class integrates pytest results, coverage monitoring, compatibility analysis,
106    and system health metrics to provide authoritative production readiness scoring
107    aligned with CLAUDE.md quality standards and research-grade requirements.
108    """
109
110    def __init__(self, project_root: Path = PROJECT_ROOT):
111        """Initialize production readiness scorer with comprehensive quality gates.
112
113        Args:
114            project_root: Path to the project root directory
115        """
116        self.project_root = project_root
117        self.db_path = project_root / "artifacts" / "production_readiness.db"
118
119        # Initialize component integrations
120        self.coverage_monitor = CoverageMonitor() if CoverageMonitor else None
121        self.compatibility_matrix = CompatibilityMatrix() if CompatibilityMatrix else None
122        self.pytest_coordinator = PytestIntegrationCoordinator() if PytestIntegrationCoordinator else None
123
124        # Ensure artifacts directory exists
125        self.db_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
126
127        # Initialize database for historical tracking
128        self._init_database()
129
130        # Quality gate definitions aligned with CLAUDE.md
131        self.quality_gates_config = {
132            "overall_test_coverage": {
133                "category": ComponentType.TESTING,
134                "threshold": 85.0,
135                "weight": 0.15,
136                "critical": False,
137                "description": "Overall system test coverage must meet 85% threshold"
138            },
139            "critical_component_coverage": {
140                "category": ComponentType.SAFETY_CRITICAL,
141                "threshold": 95.0,
142                "weight": 0.20,
143                "critical": True,
144                "description": "Critical components (controllers, plant models) must have â‰¥95% coverage"
145            },
146            "safety_critical_coverage": {
147                "category": ComponentType.SAFETY_CRITICAL,
148                "threshold": 100.0,
149                "weight": 0.15,
150                "critical": True,
151                "description": "Safety-critical mechanisms must have 100% test coverage"
152            },
153            "test_pass_rate": {
154                "category": ComponentType.TESTING,
155                "threshold": 95.0,
156                "weight": 0.10,
157                "critical": True,
158                "description": "Test pass rate must be â‰¥95% for production deployment"
159            },
160            "system_compatibility": {
161                "category": ComponentType.INTEGRATION,
162                "threshold": 85.0,
163                "weight": 0.15,
164                "critical": False,
165                "description": "Cross-domain compatibility score must be â‰¥85%"
166            },
167            "performance_benchmarks": {
168                "category": ComponentType.PERFORMANCE,
169                "threshold": 90.0,
170                "weight": 0.10,
171                "critical": False,
172                "description": "Performance benchmarks must pass regression detection"
173            },
174            "numerical_stability": {
175                "category": ComponentType.CONTROLLERS,
176                "threshold": 95.0,
177                "weight": 0.10,
178                "critical": True,
179                "description": "Controllers must demonstrate numerical stability under test conditions"
180            },
181            "documentation_completeness": {
182                "category": ComponentType.DOCUMENTATION,
183                "threshold": 90.0,
184                "weight": 0.05,
185                "critical": False,
186                "description": "API documentation and usage guides must be comprehensive"
187            }
188        }
189
190    def _init_database(self):
191        """Initialize SQLite database for production readiness tracking."""
192        with sqlite3.connect(self.db_path) as conn:
193            conn.execute("""
194                CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS readiness_assessments (
195                    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
196                    timestamp TEXT NOT NULL,
197                    overall_score REAL NOT NULL,
198                    readiness_level TEXT NOT NULL,
199                    testing_score REAL NOT NULL,
200                    coverage_score REAL NOT NULL,
201                    compatibility_score REAL NOT NULL,
202                    performance_score REAL NOT NULL,
203                    safety_score REAL NOT NULL,
204                    documentation_score REAL NOT NULL,
205                    deployment_approved BOOLEAN NOT NULL,
206                    confidence_level TEXT NOT NULL,
207                    improvement_trend TEXT NOT NULL,
208                    data_json TEXT,
209                    created_at TEXT DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
210                )
211            """)
212
213            conn.execute("""
214                CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_timestamp
215                ON readiness_assessments(timestamp)
216            """)
217
218    def assess_production_readiness(self,
219                                  run_tests: bool = True,
220                                  include_benchmarks: bool = False,
221                                  quick_mode: bool = False) -> ReadinessAssessment:
222        """Perform comprehensive production readiness assessment.
223
224        Args:
225            run_tests: Whether to execute pytest suite
226            include_benchmarks: Whether to include performance benchmarks
227            quick_mode: Whether to run in quick mode (excludes slow tests)
228
229        Returns:
230            Complete production readiness assessment
231        """
232        start_time = datetime.now()
233
234        # Execute comprehensive testing if requested
235        pytest_results = None
236        if run_tests and self.pytest_coordinator:
237            try:
238                pytest_results = self.pytest_coordinator.execute_comprehensive_test_suite(
239                    quick_mode=quick_mode,
240                    domain_filter=None,
241                    generate_reports=True
242                )
243            except Exception as e:
244                logger.error(f"Failed to execute pytest suite: {e}")
245
246        # Gather coverage metrics
247        coverage_metrics = self._gather_coverage_metrics()
248
249        # Perform compatibility analysis
250        compatibility_analysis = None
251        if self.compatibility_matrix:
252            try:
253                compatibility_analysis = self.compatibility_matrix.analyze_full_system_compatibility()
254            except Exception as e:
255                logger.error(f"Failed to perform compatibility analysis: {e}")
256
257        # Calculate component scores
258        testing_score = self._calculate_testing_score(pytest_results)
259        coverage_score = self._calculate_coverage_score(coverage_metrics)
260        compatibility_score = self._calculate_compatibility_score(compatibility_analysis)
261        performance_score = self._calculate_performance_score(pytest_results, include_benchmarks)
262        safety_score = self._calculate_safety_score(coverage_metrics, pytest_results)
263        documentation_score = self._calculate_documentation_score()
264
265        # Evaluate quality gates
266        quality_gates = self._evaluate_quality_gates(
267            pytest_results, coverage_metrics, compatibility_analysis
268        )
269
270        # Calculate overall readiness score
271        overall_score = self._calculate_overall_score(quality_gates)
272
273        # Determine readiness level
274        readiness_level = self._determine_readiness_level(overall_score, quality_gates)
275
276        # Check for blocking issues
277        blocking_issues = self._identify_blocking_issues(quality_gates)
278
279        # Generate recommendations
280        recommendations = self._generate_recommendations(quality_gates, readiness_level)
281
282        # Analyze trends
283        improvement_trend = self._analyze_improvement_trend(overall_score)
284        historical_comparison = self._get_historical_comparison()
285
286        # Create assessment
287        assessment = ReadinessAssessment(
288            timestamp=start_time.isoformat(),
289            overall_score=overall_score,
290            readiness_level=readiness_level,
291            quality_gates=quality_gates,
292            testing_score=testing_score,
293            coverage_score=coverage_score,
294            compatibility_score=compatibility_score,
295            performance_score=performance_score,
296            safety_score=safety_score,
297            documentation_score=documentation_score,
298            pytest_results=asdict(pytest_results) if pytest_results else None,
299            coverage_metrics=coverage_metrics,
300            compatibility_analysis=compatibility_analysis,
301            deployment_approved=readiness_level in [ReadinessLevel.PRODUCTION_READY, ReadinessLevel.CONDITIONAL_READY],
302            blocking_issues=blocking_issues,
303            recommendations=recommendations,
304            confidence_level=self._calculate_confidence_level(overall_score, quality_gates),
305            improvement_trend=improvement_trend,
306            historical_comparison=historical_comparison
307        )
308
309        # Store assessment in database
310        self._store_assessment(assessment)
311
312        return assessment
313
314    def _gather_coverage_metrics(self) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
315        """Gather current coverage metrics from monitoring system."""
316        if not self.coverage_monitor:
317            return None
318
319        try:
320            recent_metrics = self.coverage_monitor.get_recent_metrics(1)
321            if recent_metrics:
322                return asdict(recent_metrics[0])
323        except Exception as e:
324            logger.warning(f"Failed to gather coverage metrics: {e}")
325
326        return None
327
328    def _calculate_testing_score(self, pytest_results: Optional[TestExecutionResult]) -> float:
329        """Calculate testing component score based on pytest results."""
330        if not pytest_results:
331            return 50.0  # Default score when tests not run
332
333        # Calculate pass rate
334        total_tests = pytest_results.total_tests
335        passed_tests = pytest_results.passed_tests
336
337        if total_tests == 0:
338            return 0.0
339
340        pass_rate = (passed_tests / total_tests) * 100
341
342        # Weight different aspects of testing
343        test_execution_score = min(100.0, pass_rate * 1.05)  # Slight bonus for high pass rates
344        test_coverage_score = min(100.0, len(pytest_results.artifacts_generated) * 20)  # Bonus for artifacts
345
346        return (test_execution_score * 0.8) + (test_coverage_score * 0.2)
347
348    def _calculate_coverage_score(self, coverage_metrics: Optional[Dict[str, Any]]) -> float:
349        """Calculate coverage component score."""
350        if not coverage_metrics:
351            return 50.0  # Default score when coverage unavailable
352
353        overall = coverage_metrics.get('overall_coverage', 0)
354        critical = coverage_metrics.get('critical_coverage', 0)
355        safety = coverage_metrics.get('safety_coverage', 0)
356
357        # Weighted average with emphasis on critical components
358        weighted_score = (overall * 0.4) + (critical * 0.4) + (safety * 0.2)
359
360        return min(100.0, weighted_score)
361
362    def _calculate_compatibility_score(self, compatibility_analysis: Optional[Dict[str, Any]]) -> float:
363        """Calculate compatibility component score."""
364        if not compatibility_analysis:
365            return 75.0  # Default score when analysis unavailable
366
367        return compatibility_analysis.get('system_health_score', 75.0)
368
369    def _calculate_performance_score(self, pytest_results: Optional[TestExecutionResult],
370                                   include_benchmarks: bool) -> float:
371        """Calculate performance component score."""
372        base_score = 80.0  # Default performance score
373
374        if pytest_results:
375            # Factor in execution time efficiency
376            execution_time = pytest_results.duration_seconds
377            if execution_time < 300:  # Under 5 minutes
378                base_score += 10.0
379            elif execution_time > 1800:  # Over 30 minutes
380                base_score -= 20.0
381
382        if include_benchmarks:
383            # Would analyze benchmark results if available
384            base_score += 10.0  # Bonus for running benchmarks
385
386        return min(100.0, base_score)
387
388    def _calculate_safety_score(self, coverage_metrics: Optional[Dict[str, Any]],
389                              pytest_results: Optional[TestExecutionResult]) -> float:
390        """Calculate safety component score."""
391        if not coverage_metrics:
392            return 60.0  # Conservative default for safety
393
394        safety_coverage = coverage_metrics.get('safety_coverage', 0)
395        critical_coverage = coverage_metrics.get('critical_coverage', 0)
396
397        # Safety score heavily weighted on coverage
398        safety_score = (safety_coverage * 0.6) + (critical_coverage * 0.4)
399
400        # Penalty for failed tests in safety-critical areas
401        if pytest_results and pytest_results.failed_tests > 0:
402            safety_score -= min(30.0, pytest_results.failed_tests * 5)
403
404        return max(0.0, min(100.0, safety_score))
405
406    def _calculate_documentation_score(self) -> float:
407        """Calculate documentation component score."""
408        # Simplified documentation assessment
409        doc_dirs = [
410            self.project_root / "docs",
411            self.project_root / "README.md",
412            self.project_root / "CHANGELOG.md"
413        ]
414
415        existing_docs = sum(1 for doc_path in doc_dirs if doc_path.exists())
416        doc_score = (existing_docs / len(doc_dirs)) * 100
417
418        # Check for API documentation
419        api_docs = self.project_root / "docs" / "api"
420        if api_docs.exists():
421            doc_score += 10.0
422
423        return min(100.0, doc_score)
424
425    def _evaluate_quality_gates(self, pytest_results: Optional[TestExecutionResult],
426                               coverage_metrics: Optional[Dict[str, Any]],
427                               compatibility_analysis: Optional[Dict[str, Any]]) -> List[QualityGate]:
428        """Evaluate all quality gates against current system state."""
429        quality_gates = []
430
431        for gate_name, gate_config in self.quality_gates_config.items():
432            current_value = self._get_gate_current_value(
433                gate_name, pytest_results, coverage_metrics, compatibility_analysis
434            )
435
436            gate = QualityGate(
437                name=gate_name,
438                category=gate_config["category"],
439                threshold=gate_config["threshold"],
440                current_value=current_value,
441                weight=gate_config["weight"],
442                passed=current_value >= gate_config["threshold"],
443                critical=gate_config["critical"],
444                description=gate_config["description"],
445                recommendations=self._get_gate_recommendations(gate_name, current_value, gate_config["threshold"])
446            )
447
448            quality_gates.append(gate)
449
450        return quality_gates
451
452    def _get_gate_current_value(self, gate_name: str,
453                               pytest_results: Optional[TestExecutionResult],
454                               coverage_metrics: Optional[Dict[str, Any]],
455                               compatibility_analysis: Optional[Dict[str, Any]]) -> float:
456        """Get current value for a specific quality gate."""
457
458        if gate_name == "overall_test_coverage":
459            return coverage_metrics.get('overall_coverage', 0) if coverage_metrics else 0
460
461        elif gate_name == "critical_component_coverage":
462            return coverage_metrics.get('critical_coverage', 0) if coverage_metrics else 0
463
464        elif gate_name == "safety_critical_coverage":
465            return coverage_metrics.get('safety_coverage', 0) if coverage_metrics else 0
466
467        elif gate_name == "test_pass_rate":
468            if pytest_results and pytest_results.total_tests > 0:
469                return (pytest_results.passed_tests / pytest_results.total_tests) * 100
470            return 0
471
472        elif gate_name == "system_compatibility":
473            return compatibility_analysis.get('system_health_score', 0) if compatibility_analysis else 0
474
475        elif gate_name == "performance_benchmarks":
476            # Simplified - would integrate with actual benchmark results
477            return 85.0  # Default assuming benchmarks pass
478
479        elif gate_name == "numerical_stability":
480            # Simplified - would analyze controller stability test results
481            return 90.0  # Default assuming stability tests pass
482
483        elif gate_name == "documentation_completeness":
484            return self._calculate_documentation_score()
485
486        return 0.0
487
488    def _get_gate_recommendations(self, gate_name: str, current_value: float, threshold: float) -> List[str]:
489        """Get recommendations for improving a specific quality gate."""
490        if current_value >= threshold:
491            return ["âœ… Quality gate passed"]
492
493        gap = threshold - current_value
494        recommendations = []
495
496        if gate_name == "overall_test_coverage":
497            recommendations.extend([
498                f"Increase test coverage by {gap:.1f} percentage points",
499                "Focus on untested modules and edge cases",
500                "Add integration tests for complex workflows"
501            ])
502
503        elif gate_name == "critical_component_coverage":
504            recommendations.extend([
505                f"Increase critical component coverage by {gap:.1f} percentage points",
506                "Prioritize controllers and plant models testing",
507                "Add property-based tests for stability verification"
508            ])
509
510        elif gate_name == "test_pass_rate":
511            recommendations.extend([
512                f"Fix failing tests to improve pass rate by {gap:.1f} percentage points",
513                "Investigate and resolve test failures",
514                "Consider test environment stability issues"
515            ])
516
517        elif gate_name == "system_compatibility":
518            recommendations.extend([
519                f"Improve system compatibility score by {gap:.1f} points",
520                "Address cross-domain integration issues",
521                "Validate interface compatibility"
522            ])
523
524        else:
525            recommendations.append(f"Improve {gate_name} by {gap:.1f} points")
526
527        return recommendations
528
529    def _calculate_overall_score(self, quality_gates: List[QualityGate]) -> float:
530        """Calculate weighted overall readiness score."""
531        total_weighted_score = 0.0
532        total_weight = 0.0
533
534        for gate in quality_gates:
535            gate_score = min(100.0, (gate.current_value / gate.threshold) * 100)
536            weighted_score = gate_score * gate.weight
537            total_weighted_score += weighted_score
538            total_weight += gate.weight
539
540        return (total_weighted_score / total_weight) if total_weight > 0 else 0.0
541
542    def _determine_readiness_level(self, overall_score: float, quality_gates: List[QualityGate]) -> ReadinessLevel:
543        """Determine production readiness level based on score and gate status."""
544        critical_failures = [gate for gate in quality_gates if gate.critical and not gate.passed]
545
546        if len(critical_failures) > 0:
547            return ReadinessLevel.BLOCKED
548        elif overall_score >= 95.0:
549            return ReadinessLevel.PRODUCTION_READY
550        elif overall_score >= 85.0:
551            return ReadinessLevel.CONDITIONAL_READY
552        elif overall_score >= 70.0:
553            return ReadinessLevel.NEEDS_IMPROVEMENT
554        else:
555            return ReadinessLevel.NOT_READY
556
557    def _identify_blocking_issues(self, quality_gates: List[QualityGate]) -> List[str]:
558        """Identify blocking issues preventing production deployment."""
559        blocking_issues = []
560
561        for gate in quality_gates:
562            if gate.critical and not gate.passed:
563                gap = gate.threshold - gate.current_value
564                blocking_issues.append(
565                    f"CRITICAL: {gate.name} at {gate.current_value:.1f}%, "
566                    f"needs {gap:.1f}% improvement to reach {gate.threshold:.1f}% threshold"
567                )
568
569        return blocking_issues
570
571    def _generate_recommendations(self, quality_gates: List[QualityGate],
572                                readiness_level: ReadinessLevel) -> List[str]:
573        """Generate comprehensive recommendations for improving readiness."""
574        recommendations = []
575
576        # Add level-specific recommendations
577        if readiness_level == ReadinessLevel.BLOCKED:
578            recommendations.append("ğŸš¨ BLOCKED: Address critical quality gate failures before deployment")
579        elif readiness_level == ReadinessLevel.NOT_READY:
580            recommendations.append("â›” NOT READY: Significant improvements required across multiple areas")
581        elif readiness_level == ReadinessLevel.NEEDS_IMPROVEMENT:
582            recommendations.append("âš ï¸ IMPROVEMENT NEEDED: Address quality gaps before production")
583        elif readiness_level == ReadinessLevel.CONDITIONAL_READY:
584            recommendations.append("âœ… CONDITIONALLY READY: Deploy with enhanced monitoring")
585        else:
586            recommendations.append("ğŸš€ PRODUCTION READY: System meets all quality requirements")
587
588        # Add gate-specific recommendations
589        failed_gates = [gate for gate in quality_gates if not gate.passed]
590        if failed_gates:
591            recommendations.append(f"ğŸ“‹ Address {len(failed_gates)} quality gate failures:")
592            for gate in failed_gates[:5]:  # Top 5 failures
593                recommendations.extend([f"   - {rec}" for rec in gate.recommendations[:2]])
594
595        # Add general recommendations
596        recommendations.extend([
597            "ğŸ§ª Run comprehensive integration tests before deployment",
598            "ğŸ“Š Monitor production readiness trends and address regressions",
599            "ğŸ” Validate cross-domain compatibility regularly"
600        ])
601
602        return recommendations
603
604    def _calculate_confidence_level(self, overall_score: float, quality_gates: List[QualityGate]) -> str:
605        """Calculate confidence level in readiness assessment."""
606        critical_passed = all(gate.passed for gate in quality_gates if gate.critical)
607
608        if overall_score >= 95.0 and critical_passed:
609            return "very_high"
610        elif overall_score >= 85.0 and critical_passed:
611            return "high"
612        elif overall_score >= 70.0:
613            return "medium"
614        else:
615            return "low"
616
617    def _analyze_improvement_trend(self, current_score: float) -> str:
618        """Analyze improvement trend based on historical data."""
619        try:
620            with sqlite3.connect(self.db_path) as conn:
621                cursor = conn.execute("""
622                    SELECT overall_score FROM readiness_assessments
623                    ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 5
624                """)
625
626                recent_scores = [row[0] for row in cursor.fetchall()]
627
628                if len(recent_scores) < 2:
629                    return "insufficient_data"
630
631                # Calculate trend
632                recent_avg = sum(recent_scores[1:]) / len(recent_scores[1:])
633
634                if current_score > recent_avg + 2:
635                    return "improving"
636                elif current_score < recent_avg - 2:
637                    return "declining"
638                else:
639                    return "stable"
640
641        except Exception:
642            return "unknown"
643
644    def _get_historical_comparison(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
645        """Get historical comparison data."""
646        try:
647            with sqlite3.connect(self.db_path) as conn:
648                cursor = conn.execute("""
649                    SELECT overall_score, readiness_level, timestamp
650                    FROM readiness_assessments
651                    ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 10
652                """)
653
654                history = cursor.fetchall()
655
656                if not history:
657                    return {}
658
659                return {
660                    "previous_score": history[0][0] if len(history) > 1 else None,
661                    "score_change": None,  # Would calculate change
662                    "historical_high": max(row[0] for row in history),
663                    "historical_low": min(row[0] for row in history),
664                    "assessments_count": len(history)
665                }
666
667        except Exception:
668            return {}
669
670    def _store_assessment(self, assessment: ReadinessAssessment):
671        """Store assessment in database for historical tracking."""
672        try:
673            with sqlite3.connect(self.db_path) as conn:
674                conn.execute("""
675                    INSERT INTO readiness_assessments
676                    (timestamp, overall_score, readiness_level, testing_score,
677                     coverage_score, compatibility_score, performance_score,
678                     safety_score, documentation_score, deployment_approved,
679                     confidence_level, improvement_trend, data_json)
680                    VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)
681                """, (
682                    assessment.timestamp,
683                    assessment.overall_score,
684                    assessment.readiness_level.value,
685                    assessment.testing_score,
686                    assessment.coverage_score,
687                    assessment.compatibility_score,
688                    assessment.performance_score,
689                    assessment.safety_score,
690                    assessment.documentation_score,
691                    assessment.deployment_approved,
692                    assessment.confidence_level,
693                    assessment.improvement_trend,
694                    json.dumps(asdict(assessment))
695                ))
696        except Exception as e:
697            logger.warning(f"Failed to store assessment: {e}")
698
699def main():
700    """Main entry point for production readiness assessment."""
701    import argparse
702
703    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="Production readiness assessment")
704    parser.add_argument('--no-tests', action='store_true', help='Skip pytest execution')
705    parser.add_argument('--quick', action='store_true', help='Quick mode assessment')
706    parser.add_argument('--benchmarks', action='store_true', help='Include performance benchmarks')
707    parser.add_argument('--export', type=str, help='Export results to JSON file')
708
709    args = parser.parse_args()
710
711    scorer = ProductionReadinessScorer()
712
713    print("ğŸ” Starting production readiness assessment...")
714    assessment = scorer.assess_production_readiness(
715        run_tests=not args.no_tests,
716        include_benchmarks=args.benchmarks,
717        quick_mode=args.quick
718    )
719
720    # Display results
721    print(f"\n{'='*80}")
722    print(f"PRODUCTION READINESS ASSESSMENT")
723    print(f"{'='*80}")
724    print(f"Overall Score: {assessment.overall_score:.1f}/100")
725    print(f"Readiness Level: {assessment.readiness_level.value.upper()}")
726    print(f"Deployment Approved: {'YES' if assessment.deployment_approved else 'NO'}")
727    print(f"Confidence: {assessment.confidence_level}")
728
729    print(f"\nğŸ“Š COMPONENT SCORES:")
730    print(f"  Testing: {assessment.testing_score:.1f}/100")
731    print(f"  Coverage: {assessment.coverage_score:.1f}/100")
732    print(f"  Compatibility: {assessment.compatibility_score:.1f}/100")
733    print(f"  Performance: {assessment.performance_score:.1f}/100")
734    print(f"  Safety: {assessment.safety_score:.1f}/100")
735    print(f"  Documentation: {assessment.documentation_score:.1f}/100")
736
737    if assessment.blocking_issues:
738        print(f"\nğŸš¨ BLOCKING ISSUES:")
739        for issue in assessment.blocking_issues:
740            print(f"  - {issue}")
741
742    print(f"\nğŸ’¡ RECOMMENDATIONS:")
743    for rec in assessment.recommendations[:5]:  # Top 5 recommendations
744        print(f"  {rec}")
745
746    # Export if requested
747    if args.export:
748        export_path = Path(args.export)
749        with open(export_path, 'w') as f:
750            json.dump(asdict(assessment), f, indent=2, default=str)
751        print(f"\nğŸ“„ Results exported to: {export_path}")
752
753if __name__ == "__main__":
754    main()

ProductionReadinessScorerÂ¶

Comprehensive production readiness scoring system with pytest integration.

This class integrates pytest results, coverage monitoring, compatibility analysis, and system health metrics to provide authoritative production readiness scoring aligned with CLAUDE.md quality standards and research-grade requirements.

Source CodeÂ¶

  1class ProductionReadinessScorer:
  2    """Comprehensive production readiness scoring system with pytest integration.
  3
  4    This class integrates pytest results, coverage monitoring, compatibility analysis,
  5    and system health metrics to provide authoritative production readiness scoring
  6    aligned with CLAUDE.md quality standards and research-grade requirements.
  7    """
  8
  9    def __init__(self, project_root: Path = PROJECT_ROOT):
 10        """Initialize production readiness scorer with comprehensive quality gates.
 11
 12        Args:
 13            project_root: Path to the project root directory
 14        """
 15        self.project_root = project_root
 16        self.db_path = project_root / "artifacts" / "production_readiness.db"
 17
 18        # Initialize component integrations
 19        self.coverage_monitor = CoverageMonitor() if CoverageMonitor else None
 20        self.compatibility_matrix = CompatibilityMatrix() if CompatibilityMatrix else None
 21        self.pytest_coordinator = PytestIntegrationCoordinator() if PytestIntegrationCoordinator else None
 22
 23        # Ensure artifacts directory exists
 24        self.db_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
 25
 26        # Initialize database for historical tracking
 27        self._init_database()
 28
 29        # Quality gate definitions aligned with CLAUDE.md
 30        self.quality_gates_config = {
 31            "overall_test_coverage": {
 32                "category": ComponentType.TESTING,
 33                "threshold": 85.0,
 34                "weight": 0.15,
 35                "critical": False,
 36                "description": "Overall system test coverage must meet 85% threshold"
 37            },
 38            "critical_component_coverage": {
 39                "category": ComponentType.SAFETY_CRITICAL,
 40                "threshold": 95.0,
 41                "weight": 0.20,
 42                "critical": True,
 43                "description": "Critical components (controllers, plant models) must have â‰¥95% coverage"
 44            },
 45            "safety_critical_coverage": {
 46                "category": ComponentType.SAFETY_CRITICAL,
 47                "threshold": 100.0,
 48                "weight": 0.15,
 49                "critical": True,
 50                "description": "Safety-critical mechanisms must have 100% test coverage"
 51            },
 52            "test_pass_rate": {
 53                "category": ComponentType.TESTING,
 54                "threshold": 95.0,
 55                "weight": 0.10,
 56                "critical": True,
 57                "description": "Test pass rate must be â‰¥95% for production deployment"
 58            },
 59            "system_compatibility": {
 60                "category": ComponentType.INTEGRATION,
 61                "threshold": 85.0,
 62                "weight": 0.15,
 63                "critical": False,
 64                "description": "Cross-domain compatibility score must be â‰¥85%"
 65            },
 66            "performance_benchmarks": {
 67                "category": ComponentType.PERFORMANCE,
 68                "threshold": 90.0,
 69                "weight": 0.10,
 70                "critical": False,
 71                "description": "Performance benchmarks must pass regression detection"
 72            },
 73            "numerical_stability": {
 74                "category": ComponentType.CONTROLLERS,
 75                "threshold": 95.0,
 76                "weight": 0.10,
 77                "critical": True,
 78                "description": "Controllers must demonstrate numerical stability under test conditions"
 79            },
 80            "documentation_completeness": {
 81                "category": ComponentType.DOCUMENTATION,
 82                "threshold": 90.0,
 83                "weight": 0.05,
 84                "critical": False,
 85                "description": "API documentation and usage guides must be comprehensive"
 86            }
 87        }
 88
 89    def _init_database(self):
 90        """Initialize SQLite database for production readiness tracking."""
 91        with sqlite3.connect(self.db_path) as conn:
 92            conn.execute("""
 93                CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS readiness_assessments (
 94                    id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
 95                    timestamp TEXT NOT NULL,
 96                    overall_score REAL NOT NULL,
 97                    readiness_level TEXT NOT NULL,
 98                    testing_score REAL NOT NULL,
 99                    coverage_score REAL NOT NULL,
100                    compatibility_score REAL NOT NULL,
101                    performance_score REAL NOT NULL,
102                    safety_score REAL NOT NULL,
103                    documentation_score REAL NOT NULL,
104                    deployment_approved BOOLEAN NOT NULL,
105                    confidence_level TEXT NOT NULL,
106                    improvement_trend TEXT NOT NULL,
107                    data_json TEXT,
108                    created_at TEXT DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
109                )
110            """)
111
112            conn.execute("""
113                CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_timestamp
114                ON readiness_assessments(timestamp)
115            """)
116
117    def assess_production_readiness(self,
118                                  run_tests: bool = True,
119                                  include_benchmarks: bool = False,
120                                  quick_mode: bool = False) -> ReadinessAssessment:
121        """Perform comprehensive production readiness assessment.
122
123        Args:
124            run_tests: Whether to execute pytest suite
125            include_benchmarks: Whether to include performance benchmarks
126            quick_mode: Whether to run in quick mode (excludes slow tests)
127
128        Returns:
129            Complete production readiness assessment
130        """
131        start_time = datetime.now()
132
133        # Execute comprehensive testing if requested
134        pytest_results = None
135        if run_tests and self.pytest_coordinator:
136            try:
137                pytest_results = self.pytest_coordinator.execute_comprehensive_test_suite(
138                    quick_mode=quick_mode,
139                    domain_filter=None,
140                    generate_reports=True
141                )
142            except Exception as e:
143                logger.error(f"Failed to execute pytest suite: {e}")
144
145        # Gather coverage metrics
146        coverage_metrics = self._gather_coverage_metrics()
147
148        # Perform compatibility analysis
149        compatibility_analysis = None
150        if self.compatibility_matrix:
151            try:
152                compatibility_analysis = self.compatibility_matrix.analyze_full_system_compatibility()
153            except Exception as e:
154                logger.error(f"Failed to perform compatibility analysis: {e}")
155
156        # Calculate component scores
157        testing_score = self._calculate_testing_score(pytest_results)
158        coverage_score = self._calculate_coverage_score(coverage_metrics)
159        compatibility_score = self._calculate_compatibility_score(compatibility_analysis)
160        performance_score = self._calculate_performance_score(pytest_results, include_benchmarks)
161        safety_score = self._calculate_safety_score(coverage_metrics, pytest_results)
162        documentation_score = self._calculate_documentation_score()
163
164        # Evaluate quality gates
165        quality_gates = self._evaluate_quality_gates(
166            pytest_results, coverage_metrics, compatibility_analysis
167        )
168
169        # Calculate overall readiness score
170        overall_score = self._calculate_overall_score(quality_gates)
171
172        # Determine readiness level
173        readiness_level = self._determine_readiness_level(overall_score, quality_gates)
174
175        # Check for blocking issues
176        blocking_issues = self._identify_blocking_issues(quality_gates)
177
178        # Generate recommendations
179        recommendations = self._generate_recommendations(quality_gates, readiness_level)
180
181        # Analyze trends
182        improvement_trend = self._analyze_improvement_trend(overall_score)
183        historical_comparison = self._get_historical_comparison()
184
185        # Create assessment
186        assessment = ReadinessAssessment(
187            timestamp=start_time.isoformat(),
188            overall_score=overall_score,
189            readiness_level=readiness_level,
190            quality_gates=quality_gates,
191            testing_score=testing_score,
192            coverage_score=coverage_score,
193            compatibility_score=compatibility_score,
194            performance_score=performance_score,
195            safety_score=safety_score,
196            documentation_score=documentation_score,
197            pytest_results=asdict(pytest_results) if pytest_results else None,
198            coverage_metrics=coverage_metrics,
199            compatibility_analysis=compatibility_analysis,
200            deployment_approved=readiness_level in [ReadinessLevel.PRODUCTION_READY, ReadinessLevel.CONDITIONAL_READY],
201            blocking_issues=blocking_issues,
202            recommendations=recommendations,
203            confidence_level=self._calculate_confidence_level(overall_score, quality_gates),
204            improvement_trend=improvement_trend,
205            historical_comparison=historical_comparison
206        )
207
208        # Store assessment in database
209        self._store_assessment(assessment)
210
211        return assessment
212
213    def _gather_coverage_metrics(self) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
214        """Gather current coverage metrics from monitoring system."""
215        if not self.coverage_monitor:
216            return None
217
218        try:
219            recent_metrics = self.coverage_monitor.get_recent_metrics(1)
220            if recent_metrics:
221                return asdict(recent_metrics[0])
222        except Exception as e:
223            logger.warning(f"Failed to gather coverage metrics: {e}")
224
225        return None
226
227    def _calculate_testing_score(self, pytest_results: Optional[TestExecutionResult]) -> float:
228        """Calculate testing component score based on pytest results."""
229        if not pytest_results:
230            return 50.0  # Default score when tests not run
231
232        # Calculate pass rate
233        total_tests = pytest_results.total_tests
234        passed_tests = pytest_results.passed_tests
235
236        if total_tests == 0:
237            return 0.0
238
239        pass_rate = (passed_tests / total_tests) * 100
240
241        # Weight different aspects of testing
242        test_execution_score = min(100.0, pass_rate * 1.05)  # Slight bonus for high pass rates
243        test_coverage_score = min(100.0, len(pytest_results.artifacts_generated) * 20)  # Bonus for artifacts
244
245        return (test_execution_score * 0.8) + (test_coverage_score * 0.2)
246
247    def _calculate_coverage_score(self, coverage_metrics: Optional[Dict[str, Any]]) -> float:
248        """Calculate coverage component score."""
249        if not coverage_metrics:
250            return 50.0  # Default score when coverage unavailable
251
252        overall = coverage_metrics.get('overall_coverage', 0)
253        critical = coverage_metrics.get('critical_coverage', 0)
254        safety = coverage_metrics.get('safety_coverage', 0)
255
256        # Weighted average with emphasis on critical components
257        weighted_score = (overall * 0.4) + (critical * 0.4) + (safety * 0.2)
258
259        return min(100.0, weighted_score)
260
261    def _calculate_compatibility_score(self, compatibility_analysis: Optional[Dict[str, Any]]) -> float:
262        """Calculate compatibility component score."""
263        if not compatibility_analysis:
264            return 75.0  # Default score when analysis unavailable
265
266        return compatibility_analysis.get('system_health_score', 75.0)
267
268    def _calculate_performance_score(self, pytest_results: Optional[TestExecutionResult],
269                                   include_benchmarks: bool) -> float:
270        """Calculate performance component score."""
271        base_score = 80.0  # Default performance score
272
273        if pytest_results:
274            # Factor in execution time efficiency
275            execution_time = pytest_results.duration_seconds
276            if execution_time < 300:  # Under 5 minutes
277                base_score += 10.0
278            elif execution_time > 1800:  # Over 30 minutes
279                base_score -= 20.0
280
281        if include_benchmarks:
282            # Would analyze benchmark results if available
283            base_score += 10.0  # Bonus for running benchmarks
284
285        return min(100.0, base_score)
286
287    def _calculate_safety_score(self, coverage_metrics: Optional[Dict[str, Any]],
288                              pytest_results: Optional[TestExecutionResult]) -> float:
289        """Calculate safety component score."""
290        if not coverage_metrics:
291            return 60.0  # Conservative default for safety
292
293        safety_coverage = coverage_metrics.get('safety_coverage', 0)
294        critical_coverage = coverage_metrics.get('critical_coverage', 0)
295
296        # Safety score heavily weighted on coverage
297        safety_score = (safety_coverage * 0.6) + (critical_coverage * 0.4)
298
299        # Penalty for failed tests in safety-critical areas
300        if pytest_results and pytest_results.failed_tests > 0:
301            safety_score -= min(30.0, pytest_results.failed_tests * 5)
302
303        return max(0.0, min(100.0, safety_score))
304
305    def _calculate_documentation_score(self) -> float:
306        """Calculate documentation component score."""
307        # Simplified documentation assessment
308        doc_dirs = [
309            self.project_root / "docs",
310            self.project_root / "README.md",
311            self.project_root / "CHANGELOG.md"
312        ]
313
314        existing_docs = sum(1 for doc_path in doc_dirs if doc_path.exists())
315        doc_score = (existing_docs / len(doc_dirs)) * 100
316
317        # Check for API documentation
318        api_docs = self.project_root / "docs" / "api"
319        if api_docs.exists():
320            doc_score += 10.0
321
322        return min(100.0, doc_score)
323
324    def _evaluate_quality_gates(self, pytest_results: Optional[TestExecutionResult],
325                               coverage_metrics: Optional[Dict[str, Any]],
326                               compatibility_analysis: Optional[Dict[str, Any]]) -> List[QualityGate]:
327        """Evaluate all quality gates against current system state."""
328        quality_gates = []
329
330        for gate_name, gate_config in self.quality_gates_config.items():
331            current_value = self._get_gate_current_value(
332                gate_name, pytest_results, coverage_metrics, compatibility_analysis
333            )
334
335            gate = QualityGate(
336                name=gate_name,
337                category=gate_config["category"],
338                threshold=gate_config["threshold"],
339                current_value=current_value,
340                weight=gate_config["weight"],
341                passed=current_value >= gate_config["threshold"],
342                critical=gate_config["critical"],
343                description=gate_config["description"],
344                recommendations=self._get_gate_recommendations(gate_name, current_value, gate_config["threshold"])
345            )
346
347            quality_gates.append(gate)
348
349        return quality_gates
350
351    def _get_gate_current_value(self, gate_name: str,
352                               pytest_results: Optional[TestExecutionResult],
353                               coverage_metrics: Optional[Dict[str, Any]],
354                               compatibility_analysis: Optional[Dict[str, Any]]) -> float:
355        """Get current value for a specific quality gate."""
356
357        if gate_name == "overall_test_coverage":
358            return coverage_metrics.get('overall_coverage', 0) if coverage_metrics else 0
359
360        elif gate_name == "critical_component_coverage":
361            return coverage_metrics.get('critical_coverage', 0) if coverage_metrics else 0
362
363        elif gate_name == "safety_critical_coverage":
364            return coverage_metrics.get('safety_coverage', 0) if coverage_metrics else 0
365
366        elif gate_name == "test_pass_rate":
367            if pytest_results and pytest_results.total_tests > 0:
368                return (pytest_results.passed_tests / pytest_results.total_tests) * 100
369            return 0
370
371        elif gate_name == "system_compatibility":
372            return compatibility_analysis.get('system_health_score', 0) if compatibility_analysis else 0
373
374        elif gate_name == "performance_benchmarks":
375            # Simplified - would integrate with actual benchmark results
376            return 85.0  # Default assuming benchmarks pass
377
378        elif gate_name == "numerical_stability":
379            # Simplified - would analyze controller stability test results
380            return 90.0  # Default assuming stability tests pass
381
382        elif gate_name == "documentation_completeness":
383            return self._calculate_documentation_score()
384
385        return 0.0
386
387    def _get_gate_recommendations(self, gate_name: str, current_value: float, threshold: float) -> List[str]:
388        """Get recommendations for improving a specific quality gate."""
389        if current_value >= threshold:
390            return ["âœ… Quality gate passed"]
391
392        gap = threshold - current_value
393        recommendations = []
394
395        if gate_name == "overall_test_coverage":
396            recommendations.extend([
397                f"Increase test coverage by {gap:.1f} percentage points",
398                "Focus on untested modules and edge cases",
399                "Add integration tests for complex workflows"
400            ])
401
402        elif gate_name == "critical_component_coverage":
403            recommendations.extend([
404                f"Increase critical component coverage by {gap:.1f} percentage points",
405                "Prioritize controllers and plant models testing",
406                "Add property-based tests for stability verification"
407            ])
408
409        elif gate_name == "test_pass_rate":
410            recommendations.extend([
411                f"Fix failing tests to improve pass rate by {gap:.1f} percentage points",
412                "Investigate and resolve test failures",
413                "Consider test environment stability issues"
414            ])
415
416        elif gate_name == "system_compatibility":
417            recommendations.extend([
418                f"Improve system compatibility score by {gap:.1f} points",
419                "Address cross-domain integration issues",
420                "Validate interface compatibility"
421            ])
422
423        else:
424            recommendations.append(f"Improve {gate_name} by {gap:.1f} points")
425
426        return recommendations
427
428    def _calculate_overall_score(self, quality_gates: List[QualityGate]) -> float:
429        """Calculate weighted overall readiness score."""
430        total_weighted_score = 0.0
431        total_weight = 0.0
432
433        for gate in quality_gates:
434            gate_score = min(100.0, (gate.current_value / gate.threshold) * 100)
435            weighted_score = gate_score * gate.weight
436            total_weighted_score += weighted_score
437            total_weight += gate.weight
438
439        return (total_weighted_score / total_weight) if total_weight > 0 else 0.0
440
441    def _determine_readiness_level(self, overall_score: float, quality_gates: List[QualityGate]) -> ReadinessLevel:
442        """Determine production readiness level based on score and gate status."""
443        critical_failures = [gate for gate in quality_gates if gate.critical and not gate.passed]
444
445        if len(critical_failures) > 0:
446            return ReadinessLevel.BLOCKED
447        elif overall_score >= 95.0:
448            return ReadinessLevel.PRODUCTION_READY
449        elif overall_score >= 85.0:
450            return ReadinessLevel.CONDITIONAL_READY
451        elif overall_score >= 70.0:
452            return ReadinessLevel.NEEDS_IMPROVEMENT
453        else:
454            return ReadinessLevel.NOT_READY
455
456    def _identify_blocking_issues(self, quality_gates: List[QualityGate]) -> List[str]:
457        """Identify blocking issues preventing production deployment."""
458        blocking_issues = []
459
460        for gate in quality_gates:
461            if gate.critical and not gate.passed:
462                gap = gate.threshold - gate.current_value
463                blocking_issues.append(
464                    f"CRITICAL: {gate.name} at {gate.current_value:.1f}%, "
465                    f"needs {gap:.1f}% improvement to reach {gate.threshold:.1f}% threshold"
466                )
467
468        return blocking_issues
469
470    def _generate_recommendations(self, quality_gates: List[QualityGate],
471                                readiness_level: ReadinessLevel) -> List[str]:
472        """Generate comprehensive recommendations for improving readiness."""
473        recommendations = []
474
475        # Add level-specific recommendations
476        if readiness_level == ReadinessLevel.BLOCKED:
477            recommendations.append("ğŸš¨ BLOCKED: Address critical quality gate failures before deployment")
478        elif readiness_level == ReadinessLevel.NOT_READY:
479            recommendations.append("â›” NOT READY: Significant improvements required across multiple areas")
480        elif readiness_level == ReadinessLevel.NEEDS_IMPROVEMENT:
481            recommendations.append("âš ï¸ IMPROVEMENT NEEDED: Address quality gaps before production")
482        elif readiness_level == ReadinessLevel.CONDITIONAL_READY:
483            recommendations.append("âœ… CONDITIONALLY READY: Deploy with enhanced monitoring")
484        else:
485            recommendations.append("ğŸš€ PRODUCTION READY: System meets all quality requirements")
486
487        # Add gate-specific recommendations
488        failed_gates = [gate for gate in quality_gates if not gate.passed]
489        if failed_gates:
490            recommendations.append(f"ğŸ“‹ Address {len(failed_gates)} quality gate failures:")
491            for gate in failed_gates[:5]:  # Top 5 failures
492                recommendations.extend([f"   - {rec}" for rec in gate.recommendations[:2]])
493
494        # Add general recommendations
495        recommendations.extend([
496            "ğŸ§ª Run comprehensive integration tests before deployment",
497            "ğŸ“Š Monitor production readiness trends and address regressions",
498            "ğŸ” Validate cross-domain compatibility regularly"
499        ])
500
501        return recommendations
502
503    def _calculate_confidence_level(self, overall_score: float, quality_gates: List[QualityGate]) -> str:
504        """Calculate confidence level in readiness assessment."""
505        critical_passed = all(gate.passed for gate in quality_gates if gate.critical)
506
507        if overall_score >= 95.0 and critical_passed:
508            return "very_high"
509        elif overall_score >= 85.0 and critical_passed:
510            return "high"
511        elif overall_score >= 70.0:
512            return "medium"
513        else:
514            return "low"
515
516    def _analyze_improvement_trend(self, current_score: float) -> str:
517        """Analyze improvement trend based on historical data."""
518        try:
519            with sqlite3.connect(self.db_path) as conn:
520                cursor = conn.execute("""
521                    SELECT overall_score FROM readiness_assessments
522                    ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 5
523                """)
524
525                recent_scores = [row[0] for row in cursor.fetchall()]
526
527                if len(recent_scores) < 2:
528                    return "insufficient_data"
529
530                # Calculate trend
531                recent_avg = sum(recent_scores[1:]) / len(recent_scores[1:])
532
533                if current_score > recent_avg + 2:
534                    return "improving"
535                elif current_score < recent_avg - 2:
536                    return "declining"
537                else:
538                    return "stable"
539
540        except Exception:
541            return "unknown"
542
543    def _get_historical_comparison(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
544        """Get historical comparison data."""
545        try:
546            with sqlite3.connect(self.db_path) as conn:
547                cursor = conn.execute("""
548                    SELECT overall_score, readiness_level, timestamp
549                    FROM readiness_assessments
550                    ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 10
551                """)
552
553                history = cursor.fetchall()
554
555                if not history:
556                    return {}
557
558                return {
559                    "previous_score": history[0][0] if len(history) > 1 else None,
560                    "score_change": None,  # Would calculate change
561                    "historical_high": max(row[0] for row in history),
562                    "historical_low": min(row[0] for row in history),
563                    "assessments_count": len(history)
564                }
565
566        except Exception:
567            return {}
568
569    def _store_assessment(self, assessment: ReadinessAssessment):
570        """Store assessment in database for historical tracking."""
571        try:
572            with sqlite3.connect(self.db_path) as conn:
573                conn.execute("""
574                    INSERT INTO readiness_assessments
575                    (timestamp, overall_score, readiness_level, testing_score,
576                     coverage_score, compatibility_score, performance_score,
577                     safety_score, documentation_score, deployment_approved,
578                     confidence_level, improvement_trend, data_json)
579                    VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)
580                """, (
581                    assessment.timestamp,
582                    assessment.overall_score,
583                    assessment.readiness_level.value,
584                    assessment.testing_score,
585                    assessment.coverage_score,
586                    assessment.compatibility_score,
587                    assessment.performance_score,
588                    assessment.safety_score,
589                    assessment.documentation_score,
590                    assessment.deployment_approved,
591                    assessment.confidence_level,
592                    assessment.improvement_trend,
593                    json.dumps(asdict(assessment))
594                ))
595        except Exception as e:
596            logger.warning(f"Failed to store assessment: {e}")

Main entry point for production readiness assessment.

Source CodeÂ¶

 1def main():
 2    """Main entry point for production readiness assessment."""
 3    import argparse
 4
 5    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="Production readiness assessment")
 6    parser.add_argument('--no-tests', action='store_true', help='Skip pytest execution')
 7    parser.add_argument('--quick', action='store_true', help='Quick mode assessment')
 8    parser.add_argument('--benchmarks', action='store_true', help='Include performance benchmarks')
 9    parser.add_argument('--export', type=str, help='Export results to JSON file')
10
11    args = parser.parse_args()
12
13    scorer = ProductionReadinessScorer()
14
15    print("ğŸ” Starting production readiness assessment...")
16    assessment = scorer.assess_production_readiness(
17        run_tests=not args.no_tests,
18        include_benchmarks=args.benchmarks,
19        quick_mode=args.quick
20    )
21
22    # Display results
23    print(f"\n{'='*80}")
24    print(f"PRODUCTION READINESS ASSESSMENT")
25    print(f"{'='*80}")
26    print(f"Overall Score: {assessment.overall_score:.1f}/100")
27    print(f"Readiness Level: {assessment.readiness_level.value.upper()}")
28    print(f"Deployment Approved: {'YES' if assessment.deployment_approved else 'NO'}")
29    print(f"Confidence: {assessment.confidence_level}")
30
31    print(f"\nğŸ“Š COMPONENT SCORES:")
32    print(f"  Testing: {assessment.testing_score:.1f}/100")
33    print(f"  Coverage: {assessment.coverage_score:.1f}/100")
34    print(f"  Compatibility: {assessment.compatibility_score:.1f}/100")
35    print(f"  Performance: {assessment.performance_score:.1f}/100")
36    print(f"  Safety: {assessment.safety_score:.1f}/100")
37    print(f"  Documentation: {assessment.documentation_score:.1f}/100")
38
39    if assessment.blocking_issues:
40        print(f"\nğŸš¨ BLOCKING ISSUES:")
41        for issue in assessment.blocking_issues:
42            print(f"  - {issue}")
43
44    print(f"\nğŸ’¡ RECOMMENDATIONS:")
45    for rec in assessment.recommendations[:5]:  # Top 5 recommendations
46        print(f"  {rec}")
47
48    # Export if requested
49    if args.export:
50        export_path = Path(args.export)
51        with open(export_path, 'w') as f:
52            json.dump(asdict(assessment), f, indent=2, default=str)
53        print(f"\nğŸ“„ Results exported to: {export_path}")
